qualifiers.applicability: Applies to non-roofed porches, entryways, and balconies.

variables.name: Roofing
variables.description: Presence or absence of a roof.

constants.name: GFA Count
constants.description: Features 'generally do not count' towards GFA.

conditions.description: If a feature is non-roofed, it generally does not count towards GFA.

exceptions.description: The term 'generally' implies there may be exceptions, but they are not specified in this text.

relationships.hierarchical: This rule is one of six categories for assessing GFA of porches, entryways, and balconies.

cross_references.ref: The following pages address the details of assessing these features.

logical_dependencies.dependency: Distinction between a 'porch' and an 'entry feature'.
logical_dependencies.description: A feature is a porch if it can 'clearly accomodate more activities than entering and leaving the house'.
logical_dependencies.ambiguity_flag: The term 'clearly accomodate' is subjective and not quantitatively defined.

qualifiers.applicability: Applies to roofed porches located on the 1st floor.

variables.name: Openness
variables.description: Openness of the sides determines if the feature counts. The specific criteria for 'openness' are not defined.

variables.name: Height
variables.description: Height is not a factor in the GFA calculation for this feature type ('regardless of the height').

constants.name: GFA Count
constants.description: Counts 'only once' towards GFA if it is determined to count.

conditions.description: If the openness of the sides meets a certain (undefined) criteria, the feature counts once towards GFA.
conditions.ambiguity_flag: The specific conditions or thresholds for 'openness' that trigger the GFA count are not defined.

relationships.hierarchical: This rule is one of six categories for assessing GFA of porches, entryways, and balconies.

cross_references.ref: The following pages address the details of assessing these features.

logical_dependencies.dependency: Distinction between a 'porch' and an 'entry feature'.
logical_dependencies.description: A feature is a porch if it can 'clearly accomodate more activities than entering and leaving the house'.
logical_dependencies.ambiguity_flag: The term 'clearly accomodate' is subjective and not quantitatively defined.

analysis_results.rule_name: Roofed entry features on the 1st floor (low height)

qualifiers.applicability: Applies to roofed entry features on the 1st floor with a height less than 12 feet from grade.
exclusions: Design and openness are not factors for this rule.

constants.name: Height Threshold
constants.description: The maximum height for this rule to apply.

conditions.description: If a 1st floor roofed entry feature is less than 12' high, it counts once towards GFA.

relationships.hierarchical: This rule is one of six categories for assessing GFA of porches, entryways, and balconies.

cross_references.ref: The following pages address the details of assessing these features.

logical_dependencies.dependency: Distinction between a 'porch' and an 'entry feature'.
logical_dependencies.description: A feature is a porch if it can 'clearly accomodate more activities than entering and leaving the house'.
logical_dependencies.ambiguity_flag: The term 'clearly accomodate' is subjective and not quantitatively defined.

analysis_results.rule_name: Roofed entry features on the 1st floor (high height / vaulted)

qualifiers.applicability: Applies to roofed entry features on the 1st floor with a height more than 12 feet from grade, also known as a 'vaulted entry feature'.
exclusions: Design and openness are not factors for this rule.

constants.name: Height Threshold
constants.description: The minimum height for this rule to apply.

conditions.description: If a 1st floor roofed entry feature is more than 12' high, it counts twice towards GFA.

relationships.hierarchical: This rule is one of six categories for assessing GFA of porches, entryways, and balconies.

cross_references.ref: The following pages address the details of assessing these features.

logical_dependencies.dependency: Distinction between a 'porch' and an 'entry feature'.
logical_dependencies.description: A feature is a porch if it can 'clearly accomodate more activities than entering and leaving the house'.
logical_dependencies.ambiguity_flag: The term 'clearly accomodate' is subjective and not quantitatively defined.

qualifiers.applicability: Applies to recessed porches on the 1st floor.

conditions.description: A combination of height, depth, and openness determines if the feature counts. If it counts, its height then determines if it counts once or twice.
conditions.ambiguity_flag: The specific conditions or thresholds for height, depth, and openness that determine whether the feature counts at all are not defined.

relationships.hierarchical: This rule is one of six categories for assessing GFA of porches, entryways, and balconies.

cross_references.ref: The following pages address the details of assessing these features.

logical_dependencies.dependency: Distinction between a 'porch' and an 'entry feature'.
logical_dependencies.description: A feature is a porch if it can 'clearly accomodate more activities than entering and leaving the house'.
logical_dependencies.ambiguity_flag: The term 'clearly accomodate' is subjective and not quantitatively defined.

analysis_results.rule_name: Roofed balconies/outdoor areas on upper floors

qualifiers.applicability: Applies to roofed balconies or other roofed outdoor areas on floors above the 1st floor.
exclusions: Design and openness are not factors for this rule.

variables.name: Floor Level
variables.description: The floor on which the feature is located.

conditions.description: If a roofed balcony or outdoor area is on an upper floor (not the 1st), it counts once towards GFA.

relationships.hierarchical: This rule is one of six categories for assessing GFA of porches, entryways, and balconies.

cross_references.ref: The following pages address the details of assessing these features.
